newsitem.title: USA: Mild earthquake jolts Los Angeles area.
newsitem.headline: Mild earthquake jolts Los Angeles area.

text.p: A mild earthquake jolted parts of Los Angeles on Friday, but authorities said there were no reports of injuries or serious damages.

According to the California Institute of Technology, which monitors earthquakes, a temblor with a preliminary magnitude of 3.3 jolted the West Los Angeles area shortly before 1:30 a.m. PST (0930 GMT).

The earthquake was centred 3 miles (4.8 km) north-northeast of the Los Angeles suburb of Inglewood. Police said they received calls from some residents who said they were awokened by two short jolts. Police said there were no immediate reports of damages.
